Detailed Description

template<bool t_bManaged>
class WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >

Encapsulates a menu.

This class encapsulates the functionality associated with a Windows menu. It provides methods for creating, tracking, updating, and destroying a menu.

Create a CMenuT object on the stack frame as a local, then call CMenuT methods to manipulate the new menu as needed. Next, call SetMenu to set the menu to a window, followed immediately by a call to the CMenuT object Detach method. The SetMenu method sets the window menu to the new menu, causes the window to be redrawn to reflect the menu change, and also passes ownership of the menu to the window. The call to Detach detaches the HMENU from the CMenuT object, so that when the local CMenuT variable passes out of scope, the CMenuT object destructor does not attempt to destroy a menu it no longer owns. The menu itself is automatically destroyed when the window is destroyed.

A menu created from a resource by a call to LoadMenu is easily maintained, and the menu resource itself can be created and modified by the menu editor.

Note:
To add a menu to the command bar in Windows applications, use the CCommandBarCtrlImpl::SetMenu method.

Definition at line 112 of file atluser.h.

Constructor.

This constructor creates an instance of a CMenuT object.

Parameters:

Destructor.

If the instance type is CMenu, then the menu is destroyed. If the instance type is CMenuHandle, then nothing is done.

Member Function Documentation

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::AppendMenu (  UINT    nFlags,
UINT_PTR    nIDNewItem,
HBITMAP    hBmp
)  [inline]
 

Appends a menu.

This method appends a new item to the end of a menu.

Parameters:
nFlags  Specifies information about the state of the new menu item when it is added to the menu.
nIDNewItem  Specifies either the command ID of the new menu item or, if nFlags is set to MF_POPUP, the menu handle (HMENU) of a pop-up menu.
hBmp  Points to a bitmap handle that will be used as the menu item.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

template<bool t_bManaged>
void WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::Attach (  HMENU    hMenuNew )  [inline]
 

Attaches a menu handle.

This method attaches an existing Windows menu to a CMenuT object. This method should not be called if a menu is already attached to the CMenuT object. The menu handle is stored in the m_hMenu data member.

Parameters:
hMenuNew  A handle to a menu.

template<bool t_bManaged>
UINT WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::CheckMenuItem (  UINT    nIDCheckItem,
UINT    nCheck
)  [inline]
 

Sets the checked state of a menu item.

This method adds check marks to or removes check marks from menu items in a pop-up menu. The nIDCheckItem parameter specifies the item to be modified.

Parameters:
nIDCheckItem  Specifies the menu item to be checked, as determined by nCheck.
nCheck  Specifies how to check the menu item and how to determine the position of the item in the menu.
Returns:
The previous state of the item: MF_CHECKED or MF_UNCHECKED, or 0xFFFFFFFF if the menu item did not exist.

UINT    nIDLast,

UINT    nFlags
)  [inline]
 

Apply check-state on a group of menu items.

This method adds check marks to or removes check marks from menu items in a pop-up menu.

Parameters:
nIDFirst  First ID in group.
nIDLast  Last ID in group.
nIDItem  Specifies the integer identifier of the menu item or the offset of the menu item in the menu, depending on the value of nFlags.
nFlags  Specifies the interpretation of the nIDItem parameter.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

Definition at line 349 of file atluser.h.

References WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::IsMenu(), and WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::m_hMenu.

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::CreateMenu (    )  [inline]
 

Creates a menu.

This method creates a menu and attaches it to the CMenuT object.

Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.
Remarks:
Menu items can be added by using the AppendMenu or InsertMenu method.
If the menu is assigned to a window, it is automatically destroyed when the window is destroyed.

Before exiting, an application must free system resources associated with a menu if the menu is not assigned to a window. An application frees a menu by calling the DestroyMenu method.

Returns:

Menu items can be added by using the AppendMenu or InsertMenu method.
If the menu is assigned to a window, it is automatically destroyed when the window is destroyed.

Before exiting, an application must free system resources associated with a menu if the menu is not assigned to a window. An application frees a menu by calling the DestroyMenu method.

Definition at line 163 of file atluser.h.

References WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::m_hMenu.

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::DeleteMenu (  UINT    nPosition,
UINT    nFlags
)  [inline]
 

Deletes a sub-menu.

This method deletes an item from the menu. If the menu item has an associated pop-up menu, DeleteMenu destroys the handle to the pop-up menu and frees the memory used by the pop-up menu.

Whenever a menu that resides in a window is changed (whether or not the window is displayed), the application must call DrawMenuBar.

Parameters:
nPosition  Specifies the menu item that is to be deleted, as determined by nFlags.
nFlags  Is used to interpret nPosition in the following way: MF_BYCOMMAND or MF_BYPOSITION.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

Definition at line 192 of file atluser.h.

References WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::IsMenu(), and WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::m_hMenu.

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::DestroyMenu (    )  [inline]
 

Destroys the menu.

This method destroys the menu and any Windows resources that it uses. The menu is detached from the CMenuT object before it is destroyed.

The Windows DestroyMenu function is automatically called in the CMenuT destructor if the type of this object is CMenu.

Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

template<bool t_bManaged>
HMENU WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::Detach (    )  [inline]
 

Detaches a menu.

This method detaches a Windows menu from a CMenuT object and retrieves its menu handle. The m_hMenu data member is set to NULL.

Returns:
The old menu handle.

template<bool t_bManaged>
UINT WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::EnableMenuItem (  UINT    nIDEnableItem,
UINT    nEnable
)  [inline]
 

Enables a menu item.

This method either enables or disables and dims a menu item.

Parameters:
nIDEnableItem  Specifies the menu item to be enabled, as determined by nEnable. This parameter can specify pop-up menu items as well as standard menu items.
nEnable  Specifies the action to take. It can be a combination of MF_DISABLED, MF_ENABLED, or MF_GRAYED, with MF_BYCOMMAND or MF_BYPOSITION.
Returns:
Previous state (MF_DISABLED, MF_ENABLED, or MF_GRAYED) or -1 if not valid.

template<bool t_bManaged>
UINT WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::GetMenuItemID (  int    nPos )  const [inline]
 

Returns the menu item ID.

This method obtains the menu-item identifier for a menu item located at the position defined by nPos.

Parameters:
nPos  Specifies the position, zero-based, of the menu item whose ID is being retrieved.
Returns:
The item ID for the specified item in a pop-up menu if the function is successful. If the specified item is a pop-up menu, as opposed to an item within the pop-up menu, the return value is –1. If nPos corresponds to a SEPARATOR menu item, the return value is zero.

References WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::IsMenu(), and WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::m_hMenu.

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::GetMenuItemInfo (  UINT    uItem,
BOOL    bByPosition,
LPMENUITEMINFO    lpmii
)  const [inline]
 

Returns menu item information.

This method retrieves information about a menu item.

Parameters:
uItem  Identifier or position of the menu item to get information about. The meaning of this parameter depends on the value of bByPosition.
bByPosition  Value specifying the meaning of nIDItem. By default, ByPos is FALSE, which indicates that uItem is a menu item identifier. If ByPos is not set to FALSE, it indicates a menu item position.
lpmii  A pointer to a MENUITEMINFO object that contains information about the menu.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

References WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::GetMenuString(), WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::GetMenuStringLen(), WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::IsMenu(), and WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::m_hMenu.

template<bool t_bManaged>
int WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::GetMenuString (  UINT    nIDItem,
LPTSTR    lpString,
int    nMaxCount,
UINT    nFlags
)  const [inline]
 

Returns the display string of a menu item.

This method copies the label of the specified menu item to the specified buffer.

Parameters:
nIDItem  Specifies the integer identifier of the menu item or the offset of the menu item in the menu, depending on the value of nFlags.
lpString  Points to the buffer that is to receive the label.
nMaxCount  Specifies the maximum length, in bytes, of the label to be copied. If the label is longer than the maximum specified in nMaxCount, the extra characters are truncated.
nFlags  Specifies the interpretation of the nIDItem parameter.
Returns:
Specifies the actual number of bytes copied to the buffer, not including the null terminator.

Definition at line 242 of file atluser.h.

References WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::IsMenu(), and WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::m_hMenu.

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::InsertMenu (  UINT    nPosition,
UINT    nFlags,
UINT_PTR    nIDNewItem,
HBITMAP    hBmp
)  [inline]
 

Inserts a menu.

This method inserts a new menu item at the position specified by nPosition, and move other items down the menu. The application can specify the state of the menu item by setting values in nFlags.

Parameters:
nPosition  Specifies the menu item before which the new menu item is to be inserted.
nFlags  Specifies the interpretation of the nIDItem parameter.
nIDNewItem  Specifies either the command ID of the new menu item or, if nFlags is set to MF_POPUP, the menu handle (HMENU) of the pop-up menu. The nIDNewItem parameter is ignored (not needed) if nFlags is set to MF_SEPARATOR.
hBmp  The bitmap to show for the menu.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

Definition at line 324 of file atluser.h.

References WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::IsMenu(), and WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::m_hMenu.

UINT    nFlags,
UINT_PTR    nIDNewItem = 0,
LPCTSTR    lpszNewItem = NULL
)  [inline]
 

Inserts a menu.

This method inserts a new menu item at the position specified by nPosition, and move other items down the menu. The application can specify the state of the menu item by setting values in nFlags.

Parameters:

nFlags  Specifies the interpretation of the nIDItem parameter.
nIDNewItem  Specifies either the command ID of the new menu item or, if nFlags is set to MF_POPUP, the menu handle (HMENU) of the pop-up menu. The nIDNewItem parameter is ignored (not needed) if nFlags is set to MF_SEPARATOR.
lpszNewItem  Specifies the content of the new menu item.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::LoadMenu (  _U_STRINGorID    menu )  [inline]
 

Loads a menu.

This method loads a menu resource from the application executable file and attach it to the CMenuT object.

Before exiting, an application must free system resources associated with a menu if the menu is not assigned to a window. An application frees a menu by calling the DestroyMenu method.

Parameters:
menu  Points to a menu resource ID or menu resource name.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::ModifyMenu (  UINT    nPosition,
UINT    nFlags,
UINT_PTR    nIDNewItem,
HBITMAP    hBmp
)  [inline]
 

Modifies a menu item.

This method changes an existing menu item at the position specified by nPosition. The application specifies the new state of the menu item by setting values in nFlags. If this function replaces a pop-up menu associated with the menu item, it destroys the old pop-up menu and frees the memory used by the pop-up menu.

Parameters:
nPosition  Specifies the menu item to be changed.
nFlags  Specifies the interpretation of the nIDItem parameter.
nIDNewItem  Specifies either the command ID of the new menu item or, if nFlags is set to MF_POPUP, the menu handle (HMENU) of the pop-up menu. The nIDNewItem parameter is ignored (not needed) if nFlags is set to MF_SEPARATOR.
hBmp  The bitmap to show for the menu.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

Definition at line 334 of file atluser.h.

References WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::IsMenu(), and WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::m_hMenu.

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::ModifyMenu (  UINT    nPosition,
UINT    nFlags,
UINT_PTR    nIDNewItem = 0,
LPCTSTR    lpszNewItem = NULL
)  [inline]
 

Modifies a menu item.

This method changes an existing menu item at the position specified by nPosition. The application specifies the new state of the menu item by setting values in nFlags. If this function replaces a pop-up menu associated with the menu item, it destroys the old pop-up menu and frees the memory used by the pop-up menu.

Parameters:
nPosition  Specifies the menu item to be changed.
nFlags  Specifies the interpretation of the nIDItem parameter.
nIDNewItem  Specifies either the command ID of the new menu item or, if nFlags is set to MF_POPUP, the menu handle (HMENU) of the pop-up menu. The nIDNewItem parameter is ignored (not needed) if nFlags is set to MF_SEPARATOR.
lpszNewItem  Specifies the content of the new menu item.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

Definition at line 128 of file atluser.h.

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::RemoveMenu (  UINT    nPosition,
UINT    nFlags
)  [inline]
 

Removes a menu.

This method deletes a menu item that has an associated pop-up menu from the menu. It does not destroy the handle for a pop-up menu, so the menu can be reused. Before calling this function, the application may call the GetSubMenu method to retrieve the pop-up CMenuT object for reuse.

Parameters:
nPosition  Specifies the menu item to be changed.
nFlags  Specifies the interpretation of the nIDItem parameter.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::SetMenuDefaultItem (  UINT    uItem = (UINT)-1,
BOOL    bByPosition = FALSE
)  [inline]
 

Sets the default menu item.

Sets the default menu item.

Parameters:
uItem  Identifier or position of the menu item to set information. The meaning of this parameter depends on the value of bByPosition.
bByPosition  Value specifying the meaning of nIDItem. By default, ByPos is FALSE, which indicates that uItem is a menu item identifier. If ByPos is not set to FALSE, it indicates a menu item position.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::SetMenuItemInfo (  UINT    uItem,
BOOL    bByPosition,
LPMENUITEMINFO    lpmii
)  [inline]
 

Sets menu item information.

This method sets information about a menu item.

Parameters:
uItem  Identifier or position of the menu item to set information. The meaning of this parameter depends on the value of bByPosition.
bByPosition  Value specifying the meaning of nIDItem. By default, ByPos is FALSE, which indicates that uItem is a menu item identifier. If ByPos is not set to FALSE, it indicates a menu item position.
lpmii  A pointer to a MENUITEMINFO object that contains information about the menu.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

BOOL WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::TrackPopupMenu (  UINT    nFlags,
int    x,
int    y,
HWND    hWnd,
LPCRECT    lpRect = NULL

Displays a pop-up menu.

Parameters:

x  X position.
y  Y position.
hWnd  A Window handle.
lpRect  Points to a RECT or CRect that contains a rectangle.

Definition at line 197 of file atluser.h.

References WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::IsMenu(), and WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::m_hMenu.

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CMenuT< t_bManaged >::TrackPopupMenuEx (  UINT    uFlags,
int    x,
int    y,
HWND    hWnd,
LPTPMPARAMS    lptpm = NULL
)  [inline]
 

Displays a popup menu.

This method displays a floating pop-up menu at the specified location, and tracks the selection of items on the pop-up menu. A floating pop-up menu can appear anywhere on the screen.

Parameters:
uFlags  Specifies a screen-position flag and a mouse-button flag.
x  Specifies the horizontal position in screen coordinates of the pop-up menu. Depending on the value of the nFlags parameter, the menu can be left-aligned, right-aligned, or centered relative to this position. .
y  Specifies the vertical position in screen coordinates of the top of the menu on the screen. .
hWnd  A Window handle. This window receives all WM_COMMAND messages from the menu.
lptpm  Pointer to parameter structure.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.
